author: StockTitan
title: Sun Life U.S. and DentaQuest donate $50,000 to support Texas flooding relief efforts | SLF Stock News
text:
Sun Life U.S. and DentaQuest donate $50,000 to support Texas flooding relief efforts
Sun Life U.S. (NYSE:SLF) and DentaQuest have announced a $50,000 donation to support Texas flood relief efforts. The donation will be split equally between the Community Foundation of the Texas Hill Country's Kerr County Flood Relief Fund and TEXSAR (Texas Search and Rescue), each receiving $25,000.
The company also maintains an annual $20,000 donation to the American Red Cross for emergency preparedness. Sun Life is providing support to affected clients, members, dental providers, and employees in the region, offering flexibility with payments and benefit arrangements.
Sun Life U.S. (NYSE:SLF) e DentaQuest hanno annunciato una donazione di 50.000 dollari per sostenere gli sforzi di soccorso alle inondazioni in Texas. La donazione sarà divisa equamente tra il Community Foundation of the Texas Hill Country's Kerr County Flood Relief Fund e TEXSAR (Texas Search and Rescue), ciascuno riceverà 25.000 dollari.
L'azienda mantiene inoltre una donazione annuale di 20.000 dollari alla Croce Rossa Americana per la preparazione alle emergenze. Sun Life offre supporto ai clienti, membri, fornitori dentali e dipendenti colpiti nella regione, garantendo flessibilità nei pagamenti e nelle disposizioni dei benefici.
Sun Life U.S. (NYSE:SLF) y DentaQuest han anunciado una donación de 50,000 dólares para apoyar los esfuerzos de ayuda por las inundaciones en Texas. La donación se dividirá por igual entre el Community Foundation of the Texas Hill Country's Kerr County Flood Relief Fund y TEXSAR (Texas Search and Rescue), recibiendo cada uno 25,000 dólares.
La compañía también mantiene una donación anual de 20,000 dólares a la Cruz Roja Americana para la preparación ante emergencias. Sun Life brinda apoyo a los clientes, miembros, proveedores dentales y empleados afectados en la región, ofreciendo flexibilidad en los pagos y arreglos de beneficios.
Sun Life U.S. (NYSE:SLF)와 DentaQuest가 텍사스 홍수 구호 활동을 지원하기 위해 5만 달러 기부를 발표했습니다. 이 기부금은 Community Foundation of the Texas Hill Country's Kerr County Flood Relief Fund와 TEXSAR (Texas Search and Rescue)에 각각 2만 5천 달러씩 균등하게 나누어 전달됩니다.
회사는 또한 비상 대비를 위해 미국 적십자사에 매년 2만 달러 기부를 유지하고 있습니다. Sun Life는 해당 지역의 영향을 받은 고객, 회원, 치과 제공자 및 직원들에게 지원을 제공하며, 결제 및 혜택 조정에 유연성을 제공합니다.
Sun Life U.S. (NYSE:SLF) et DentaQuest ont annoncé un don de 50 000 dollars pour soutenir les efforts de secours suite aux inondations au Texas. Le don sera réparti à parts égales entre le Community Foundation of the Texas Hill Country's Kerr County Flood Relief Fund et TEXSAR (Texas Search and Rescue), chacun recevant 25 000 dollars.
L'entreprise maintient également un don annuel de 20 000 dollars à la Croix-Rouge américaine pour la préparation aux situations d'urgence. Sun Life apporte son soutien aux clients, membres, prestataires dentaires et employés affectés dans la région, en offrant une flexibilité dans les paiements et les arrangements des prestations.
Sun Life U.S. (NYSE:SLF) und DentaQuest haben eine Spende von 50.000 US-Dollar zur Unterstützung der Hochwasserhilfe in Texas angekündigt. Die Spende wird gleichmäßig zwischen dem Community Foundation of the Texas Hill Country's Kerr County Flood Relief Fund und TEXSAR (Texas Search and Rescue) aufgeteilt, wobei jeder 25.000 US-Dollar erhält.
Das Unternehmen leistet zudem eine jährliche Spende von 20.000 US-Dollar an das Amerikanische Rote Kreuz für die Notfallvorsorge. Sun Life unterstützt betroffene Kunden, Mitglieder, Zahnärzte und Mitarbeiter in der Region und bietet flexible Zahlungs- und Leistungsregelungen an.
- None.
- None.

"We offer our sincerest condolences to those who have lost loved ones amid this disaster," said Dan Fishbein, M.D., president, Sun Life
Sun Life and DentaQuest members, network dental providers and clients affected by the flood are encouraged to reach out if they have questions, need extra time to make payments or need to arrange other ways to receive their benefits. All of the information, including guidance on using Employee Assistance Programs (EAPs) can be found here.
About Sun Life
Sun Life is a leading international financial services organization providing asset management, wealth, insurance and health solutions to individual and institutional Clients. Sun Life has operations in a number of markets worldwide, including sunlife.com.
Sun Life Financial Inc. trades on the SLF.

author: commsmanager
title: ICC Helps 3 Siblings Persecuted by Cult Members in Uganda
text:
5/31/2024 Uganda (International Christian Concern) — Three siblings caught up in the Faith of Unity cult in Uganda were beaten after putting their faith in Jesus Christ.
Tereza, Usama, and Dembe grew up in the cultic church known as Itambiriro. The cult was founded by Desteo Bisaka, also known as “Owobushobozi,” which means “the Almighty One.” He believed that he was God. He died in 2021 at the age of 90 from the coronavirus.
According to Bisaka’s teachings, Jesus was “a liar” who “didn’t exist.” Bisaka often criticized Christianity and at least once called on his followers to burn Bibles. Followers of the cult are only allowed to attend their church service twice a year and are encouraged to cast spells and use magic charms, Tereza said. At least 5 million people reportedly belong to the cult, which boasts more than 1,000 places of worship in Uganda, Congo, Kenya, Rwanda, South Sudan, and Tanzania.
On December 10, 2023, area Christians visited Tereza, Usama, and Dembe and taught them about Jesus Christ. The siblings decided to accept Christ as their savior. Once word spread about their conversion to Christianity, elders from the Itambiriro church went to the siblings’ home and beat them with canes.
“The canes were given to us as a sign of judgment,” Usama said. The children were then later forced to leave their community without any money, housing, or education.
“We have seen the light of Jesus, and nothing shall separate us from the love of Jesus,” Tereza added. “We pray that God should change (the followers of Bisaka) so that they can know Christ.”
International Christian Concern (ICC) found the girls when they were living with a Christian family in a town called Kasese. ICC helped cover their school fees, meal plans, books and school uniforms, bedding, clothing, and toiletries. They are now enrolled in school and are thriving.
“I am happy to express my deepest gratitude for your incredible generosity and support towards my education,” Tereza said. “Your kindness in paying for my school fees and providing me with educational materials and clothing has had a significant impact on my life. I am truly blessed to have people like you who believe in the power of education and are willing to invest in my future.”
Usama is now staying with a Christian teacher at a local preparatory school where he is studying. Dembe is living with another believer while he attends primary school. Tereza is living on campus at a secondary school.
Now that these siblings can attend Christian schools, they can have a future and grow in their relationships with Christ without fear of persecution.
If you would like to support other students like Tereza, Usama, and Dembe, learn more about ICC’s Generation Transformation fund.
To read more news stories, visit the ICC Newsroom . For interviews, please email press@persecution.org.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 医疗设备ETF（159873）涨0.49%，半日成交额457.73万元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
7月31日，截止午间收盘，医疗设备ETF（159873）涨0.49%，报0.617元，成交额457.73万元。医疗设备ETF（159873）重仓股方面， 迈瑞医疗 截止午盘跌0.82%， 联影医疗 跌0.18%， 爱尔眼科 跌0.68%， 爱美客 跌0.83%， 惠泰医疗 涨1.26%， 新产业 跌2.07%， 鱼跃医疗 跌1.27%， 乐普医疗 涨4.02%， 美年健康 涨1.79%， 山东药玻 跌0.52%。
医疗设备ETF（159873）业绩比较基准为中证全指医疗保健设备与服务指数收益率，管理人为天弘基金管理有限公司，基金经理为贺雨轩，成立（2021-03-16）以来回报为-38.60%，近一个月回报为8.21%。

author: Amador Medina
title: They reinforce road surveillance for accidents in Tucupita - Últimas Noticias
text: Security authorities are reinforcing road surveillance after up to six traffic accidents were recorded in one week in December, involving cars and motorcycles in Tucupita. According to the statements of the governor of Delta Amacuro, Lizeta Hernández, this Thursday, the Secretariat of Citizen Security has deployed new mobile control points to influence the use of helmets in the case of motorized vehicles, the seat belt and the permitted speeds, as well as the retention of vehicles with drivers under the influence of alcohol. Hernández reported that these road safety points are in strategic places in Tucupita, where more accidents usually occur, such as on the national highway of the capital of the Delta. In one week, six traffic accidents were recorded in Tucupita, with no fatalities so far, but with material losses to third parties. Motorcycles until 10 p.m. The Secretary of Security and Public Order of the Delta Amacuro state, Noel Valderrama, reiterated that motorized vehicles can circulate until 10 p.m., if they do not have any permit or endorsement indicating that they can do so. Any required authorization must be managed by the offices of this entity. The measure seeks to reduce the so-called motorcycle crashes, irresponsible alcohol consumption and speeds not permitted by motorized vehicles. Mobilization by land terminal Arnold Suárez, sole tourism authority for the Delta Amacuro state, reported this Thursday that the Tucupita and Casacoima land terminals continue to operate “receiving families who return to the Delta for vacation” during the Christmas and New Year festivities. Thus, it maintains a data of about three thousand users who have traveled between December 24 and December 28 only through this land terminal. The enabled routes are to and from Caracas, Ciudad Guayana, Valencia, Maturín, Casacoima and Uracoa, with prices that have not changed despite the season.

author: CMS Medios
title: Olas de calor en México 2025: ¿Cuándo llegarán al país y cómo protegerte del golpe de calor?
text:
México|
¿Cuándo comienzan las olas de calor en México este 2025?
Este año será uno de los más calurosos en la historia de México
El Instituto de Ciencias de la Atmósfera y Cambio Climático de la UNAM ha alertado que este año será uno de los más calurosos en la historia de México. El pronóstico indica que las temperaturas podrían mantenerse elevadas durante varios meses, afectando a diversas regiones del país. Ante esto, el instituto recomienda a la población estar preparada para soportar el calor extremo.
El incremento en las temperaturas puede generar consecuencias graves para la salud, desde deshidratación hasta golpes de calor severos. Las autoridades instan a la ciudadanía a tomar precauciones para evitar estos riesgos. Entre las recomendaciones destacan el mantenerse hidratado y evitar la exposición directa al sol durante las horas más intensas del día.
Para hacer frente al calor en el hogar, los expertos sugieren varias estrategias. Aunque el uso de ventiladores y aire acondicionado ayuda a bajar la temperatura, también incrementa el consumo energético. Por ello, se aconseja aprovechar la ventilación cruzada, mantener cerradas las habitaciones que reciben sol directo y colocar plantas que ayuden a mitigar el calor, como el helecho o la 'lengua de tigre'.
La UNAM anticipa la llegada de cuatro olas de calor consecutivas, que comenzarán en la tercera semana de marzo y podrían extenderse hasta octubre. Los estados del norte, como Sonora, Sinaloa y Baja California, serán los más afectados. Estas olas de calor son consecuencia del cambio climático, impulsado por el aumento de las emisiones de dióxido de carbono y la mala planificación urbana.
SV
